Bud

Bud helps product owners document frequently asked questions and product features in an unobtrusive manner, and show helpful product related documentation to the users, when they need it. All of the documentation is sourced from the Prismic Repository. If you have any documents with certain keywords, you can trigger the Bud from within the DOM. For instance click here to see a list of issues tagged username issues.

You can bind the initialisation of Bud to any DOM element, for instance click the button below to see Bud with all documents containing the word 'Lav'

Dependencies

  • Bootstrap v4.0.0+
  • Animate CSS
  • FontAwesome v5

Intialisation

Copy the following script and paste it immediately after the body tag.

          
  <div id="help-root"></div>
  <script>
    function asyncBudInit(){
      bud.init({
        endpoint: 'https://auxil.cdn.prismic.io/api/v2',
        documentType: 'faq',
        orientation: '-45deg',
        colors: ['#0486ff'],
        productArea: 'leadplus'
      });
      
      bud.show(); // Shows the floating action button on the page
    }

    (function(d, s, id){
      var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
      if (d.getElementById(id)) {return;}
      js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
      js.onload = asyncBudInit;
      js.src = "https://plugin.bizongo.in/bud.js";
      fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
    })(document, 'script', 'bud');
  </script>

Usage

There are two ways to utilise the Bud plugin. You can have a floating action button on the page to trigger it, or alternatively, trigger the plugin using certain keywords. The second alternative helps teams to hook up Bud & its documents to certain event clicks, for example clicks arising from a section explaining about a particular button / feature.

          
    // Trigger the Bud plugin from a particular location on DOM
    bud.show('term to be searched'); // e.g. bud.show('yash') will open the Bud interface with all documents with the term 'yash'

    // Trigger the Bud plugin globally, without any term to be searched
    bud.show();
